title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Mass Layoff Statistic Data
text:
The Bureau of Labor Statistics briefly recorded statistics on mass layoffs. This program was implemented in the early Bush administration and was discontinued in 2013 during beginning of the second Obama administration.
This data is interesting largely because of the time that it covers. This ten year timespan overlaps the leadup to and recovery from the Great Recession. It also coincides with some states adopting “Right to Work” laws.

title: Post With Code

This is a post with executable code. This is some updated text.

import arcgis
gis = arcgis.GIS()
m = gis.map('San Francisco, CA')
m

title: Post With Code
text:
Now add a layer
Now we will add a layer of wildfires. This is available in the ArcGIS Living Atlas


Code
lyr = gis.content.get('d957997ccee7408287a963600a77f61f').layers[0]
m.content.add(lyr)
